title: Learning Code-Edit Embedding to Model Student Debugging Behavior
author: Hasnain Heickal (University of Massachusetts Amherst), Andrew Lan (University of Massachusetts Amherst), ...
relevance_why: The methods for learning meaningful code-edit embeddings and analyzing student debugging behavior could inform techniques used in audio processing and generative models, especially in analyzing iterative adjustments in audio generation tasks.
background: This paper analyzes student submissions in programming to model their debugging behavior through an encoder-decoder framework that learns from historical code edits.
contribution: This study introduces an encoder-decoder-based model to learn code-edit embeddings from student programming submissions, effectively capturing debugging behaviors and providing personalized feedback.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous approaches primarily focused on single code submissions for feedback generation, lacking analysis of iterative code modifications.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages historical submission patterns to generate incremental, personalized suggestions by analyzing the progression of code edits over time.

key_innovation: Utilizes contrastive learning to structure code-edit embeddings based on test-case outcomes, enabling a more nuanced understanding of student debugging strategies.
real_world_impact: The findings could lead to improved debugging tools in educational contexts, enhancing student engagement and learning outcomes in computer science courses.
limitations: The model may generate codes with minor syntactical errors, indicating challenges in producing fully correct suggestions.

new_terms.code-edit embeddings: **Code-edit embeddings** refer to vector representations that capture changes made between code submissions, helping to assess and generate edits.
new_terms.contrastive learning: **Contrastive learning** is a machine learning technique that learns to differentiate between similar and dissimilar instances through a structured embedding space.
